# preferredMaxLayoutWidth

**Instance Property**

A width the system uses to constrain the view contents.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var preferredMaxLayoutWidth: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

When embedding this view in a SwiftUI [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SwiftUI/UIViewRepresentable] or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SwiftUI/NSViewRepresentable] view, the system constrains its contents to the `preferredMaxLayoutWidth` width.

If you’re not using SwiftUI this property shouldn’t be necessary, as [doc://com.apple.sharedwithyou/documentation/SharedWithYou/SWAttributionView] otherwise derives the maximum width from the frame or constraints you set.

## Customizing highlights

- **backgroundStyle**: The background style of the child view that contains names and avatars.
- **displayContext**: The context for the content the system displays with this view.
- **highlight**: The highlight you use to display this attribution.
- **highlightMenu**: A menu with a list of system actions specific to this hightlight.
- **horizontalAlignment**: The horizontal alignment of the view.
- **menuTitleForHideAction**: A localized string the system uses as a custom title for the hide menu item.
- **supplementalMenu**: A supplemental menu to augment the attribution view’s existing menu.
